intro: Astragalus sphaerocarpus, commonly known as the globe milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central Asia. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, yellow pea-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its unique spherical seed pods are a distinguishing feature, and the plant is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Astragalus sphaerocarpus plays a role in soil stabilization and is of interest in ecological and botanical studies.
